english: In Japan, it is said that in the tenth month of the lunar calendar, all the gods of the country gather at Izumo-taisha, and so the tenth month, when the gods disappear from various regions, is called "the month without gods". However, in the Izumo region, where the gods gather, it is also called "the month with gods".

english: "When I was little, I once broke my mom's favorite necklace, and all the little pieces spilled onto the road." "Was she mad at you?" "I don't really remember." "Then how do you know you did that?" "She told me about it several times." "She's probably holding it against you." "You think?" "Maybe. Once you start making money, you should buy her another one to make up for it." "Alright, I will."

japanese: 今日の夕方から20時にかけ、日本の広い範囲で部分月食が起こります。今回の部分月食は、月の直径の98%が隠れるため、ほぼ皆既月食に近い状態になります。「ほぼ皆既に近い部分月食」は、日本では140年ぶりのことです。お見逃しなく。

japanese: あなたの為にならないわ。
english: It's not good for you.

japanese: ドライバーの多くが制限速度を守っていません。
english: Many drivers don't obey the speed limit.

japanese: １分間で５０文字打てるんだ。
english: I can type 50 characters in a minute.

japanese: トムは振り向きもせず立ち去った。
english: Tom left without looking back.

japanese: トムは振り返りもせず去っていった。
english: Tom left without looking back.

japanese: 彼なしじゃ何もできないの。
english: I can't do anything without him.

japanese: トムは窓際に座り、外を眺めた。
english: Tom sat at the window, looking outside.

japanese: はっきり言って、俺はトムが嫌いだ。
english: To put it bluntly, I don't like Tom.

japanese: 実を言うと、私、トムのこと何も知らないの。
english: As a matter of fact, I don't know anything about Tom.

japanese: 運よく、渋滞してなかったよ。
english: Luckily, there wasn't a traffic jam.

japanese: 見て、円盤だよ！
english: Look! A flying saucer!

japanese: 見て！空飛ぶ円盤よ！
english: Look! A flying saucer!

japanese: 豆ご飯が食べたいな。
english: I want to eat rice with beans.

japanese: 姉は２歳年上です。
english: My older sister has two years over me.

japanese: 姉は二つ上です。
english: My older sister has two years over me.

japanese: お母さん、栗ご飯食べたいから、栗ご飯作って。
english: Mom, I want some chestnut rice. Can you make some?

japanese: 家を売るなら、新しければ新しいほど、綺麗なら綺麗なほど、高値がつきますよ。
english: If you're going to sell a house, then the newer it is and the prettier it is, the higher the price it'll go for.

japanese: コーヒーには、どのぐらい砂糖が欲しいんだっけ？
english: I don't remember how much sugar you want in your coffee.

japanese: コーヒーには、どれぐらい砂糖がいるんでしたっけ？
english: I don't remember how much sugar you want in your coffee.

japanese: 子供って、誰とでも友達になれるよね。
english: Children can make friends with anyone.

japanese: これまた、大胆な発想ですね。
english: What another bold idea.

japanese: 好きだよ、そういうところ。
english: I like it like that.

japanese: その子の名前はトムです。
english: That child's name is Tom.

japanese: トムにあげるためにセーターを買ったの。
english: I bought a sweater to give to Tom.

japanese: トムにあげようと思ってセーターを買ったのよ。
english: I bought a sweater to give to Tom.

japanese: 具合が悪い時は口元を覆わないとダメだよ。
english: You have to cover your mouth when you're sick.

japanese: 学校サボって遊んでたのが親にバレちゃってさ、大目玉食らったよ。
english: My parents found out I ditched school to play, and they gave me a huge earful.

japanese: トム・ジャクソン先生は、有名なお医者さんなんだよ。
english: Dr. Tom Jackson is a famous doctor.

japanese: あなたが魚を食べてる夢を見たわ。
english: I dreamt you were eating fish.

japanese: もっといい表現方法がありますか？
english: Is there a better way to express this?

japanese: 健康は宝です。
english: Health is an asset.

japanese: ドリアンって、食べたことある？
english: Have you ever eaten durian?

japanese: コートはクローゼットにかけときなさい。
english: Hang your coats in the closet.

japanese: トムが提案した言い回しを使ってみるよ。
english: I'll try using the phrasing Tom suggested.

japanese: その映画見たけど、あんまり良くなかったよ。
english: I saw that movie, but it wasn't very good.

japanese: 注文してない商品が届いたんだ。
english: I received an item that I didn't order.

japanese: トムは年の割に細かった。
english: Tom was small for his age.

japanese: トムは年齢の割に小柄でした。
english: Tom was small for his age.

japanese: トムは歳の割に小さかった。
english: Tom was small for his age.

japanese: トムは動物には優しかったわ。
english: Tom was kind to the animals.

japanese: トムはこれまで洗濯機を使ったことがなかった。
english: Tom had never used the washing machine before.

japanese: トムは洗濯機を使ったことがないのよ。
english: Tom has never used a washing machine.

japanese: そんなこと聞いて何になるの？
english: What's the point of asking me that?

japanese: 怪我した選手はどうしてる？
english: How's the player that got hurt?

japanese: 目をつむって、片足で１分間立っていられる？
english: Can you stand on one leg for a minute with your eyes shut?

japanese: ジョンって、知ってる？
english: Do you know John?

japanese: ジョンって、わかる？
english: Do you know John?

japanese: コーヒーできたぞ。
english: Coffee's ready.

japanese: 買い物に行ったら、チーズが目に入って、買おうか？どうしようか？迷ったんだけど、「原産国名：ドイツ」って書いてあるの見て、買っちゃった。今晩は、チーズフォンデュにしよう。
english: Some cheese caught my eye while I was out shopping, and I was torn on whether I should buy it, but then I saw "Made in Germany" written on it, and I bought it after all. So, how about some cheese fondue tonight?

japanese: この魚、僕が釣ったんだけど、煮るなり焼くなり好きにして食べて。
english: I caught this fish. Feel free to eat it in whatever way you like.

japanese: 「お前のこの不自然な英文どうしよう？」「変えるなり消すなり、好きにしていいから、どうにかして」
english: "What should we do with this unnatural English sentence of yours?" "Change it or delete it. Just make it work somehow."

japanese: あなた、子供のオムツ変えるの、もう手慣れたもんね。
english: You're already used to changing kids' nappies, aren't you?

japanese: 「このマフラー、綺麗に編めたわね。前回の分と全然違うね？」「うん、なんか、手が慣れてきたみたい。ゆったり編めるようになったよ」
english: "This scarf is beautifully knit. It's completely different from what you made last time, isn't it?" "Yeah, I think my hands have just gotten used to it. I've learned how to knit comfortably."

japanese: このプレゼント、気に入っていただけるといいんですが。
english: I hope you'll be pleased with this present.

japanese: 「トム、おはよう。どうしたの？今日来るの早いね」「うん。早く目が覚めたから、来てみた」「ふぅん。そうなんだ。それはそうとして、今日の１限目の国際政治論って、休講だって知ってる？」「えっ！！」
english: "Morning, Tom. You're here early. What's up?" "I woke up early, so I just came." "Ah. Well, did you know that first period International Politics is cancelled today?" "What?"

japanese: トムはテニスのコーチなんだ。
english: Tom is a tennis coach.

japanese: ドリアンは臭いけど、体にはとてもいいと言われています。
english: Durian stinks, but it's said to be very healthy.

japanese: ドリアンはめっちゃ臭いけど、健康にはとてもいいそうよ。
english: Durian stinks, but it's said to be very healthy.

japanese: ドリアンって、超臭うけど、とても体にいいって言うよ。
english: Durian stinks, but it's said to be very healthy.

japanese: ドリアンの臭いが苦手です。
english: I don't like the smell of durian.

japanese: 僕はドリアンの匂いは平気だよ。
english: I don't mind the smell of durian.

japanese: ドリアンの香りが好きって言う人もいます。
english: Some people say they like the smell of durian.

japanese: ここ10年、病気とは無縁だ。
english: I haven't been sick for the past ten years.

japanese: 子供の面倒は誰がみてるの？
english: Who's taking care of your kids?

japanese: 子供たちの世話は誰がしてますか？
english: Who's taking care of your kids?

japanese: スパゲッティにパルメザンチーズをかけるの好き？
english: Do you like Parmesan cheese on spaghetti?

japanese: １００円しか持ってないよ。
english: I only have 100 yen on me.

japanese: １００円しかないよ。
english: I only have 100 yen on me.

japanese: 分け前が欲しいな。
english: I want my part of the money.

japanese: 料理本でビーフストロガノフの作り方を読んだんだ。
english: I read about how to make beef stroganoff in a recipe book.

japanese: 前日に購入した腕時計を紛失してしまった。
english: I lost the watch I'd bought the day before.

japanese: 雨のせいでピクニックに行けなかったんだ。
english: We couldn't go on a picnic because of the rain.

japanese: 地震を感じた時は、ゲームをしてました。
english: I was playing a game when I felt the earthquake.

japanese: トムは素敵な贈り物をしてくれました。
english: Tom gave me a nice gift.

japanese: 時がたつにつれて、その記憶は私の心から溶け出していった。
english: Over time, the memories have leached from my mind.

japanese: そういう風にできるよ。
english: You can do it like that.

japanese: そういう感じにできます。
english: It can be done like that.

japanese: 箱の上にものを載せないでください。
english: Please don't put anything on the box.

japanese: どうして雲が泣いてるの？
english: Why are the clouds crying?

japanese: 彼女はお酒を控えてるのよ。
english: She abstains from alcohol.

japanese: 彼女はアルコールを控えてるんだ。
english: She abstains from alcohol.

japanese: トムに電話をかけるつもりだったが、考え直した。
english: I was going to call Tom, but thought better of it.

japanese: トムに電話しようとしたが、思いとどまった。
english: I was going to call Tom, but thought better of it.

japanese: この生地、すべすべね。
english: This cloth is smooth.

japanese: トムは、自分の体型に劣等感を持っている。
english: Tom is insecure about his body.

japanese: トムは、メアリーに劣等感を感じている。
english: Tom feels inferior to Mary.

japanese: ここ2ケ月、目が回るほど忙しかった。
english: I've been as busy as a bee for the past two months.

japanese: ここ2カ月、多忙を極めた。
english: I've been as busy as a bee for the past two months.

japanese: トム、お前変わったな。
english: You've changed, Tom.

japanese: トムは我々の顧客の一人だ。
english: Tom is one of our customers.

japanese: それは予想だにしない出来事だった。
english: That was an unexpected event.

japanese: それは想定外の出来事であった。
english: That was an unexpected event.

japanese: トムはそれをやるがために、大きなリスクを抱えている。
english: Tom is risking a lot by doing that.

japanese: なぜ彼らが私たちに対して、怒りを抱いているのか私には分からない。
english: I don't know why they're so angry at us.

japanese: ドアが開いている光景を見たことに対して、私は非常に驚いた。
english: I was very surprised that the door was open.

japanese: 子供の世話で手いっぱいだった。
english: I had my hands full taking care of my own children.

japanese: 子供の世話で一杯一杯だったんだ。
english: I had my hands full taking care of my own children.

japanese: 電車、逃しちゃったよ。もっと早く来ればよかったな。
english: I missed the train. I should've come earlier.

japanese: 寝る前に、ほんの数ページ読んだだけであった。
english: I'd read only a few pages before I fell asleep.

japanese: 今日は、二千十六年十一月二十三日です。
english: Today is 23 November 2016.

japanese: 今日は、2016年11月23日です。
english: Today is 23 November 2016.

japanese: ペンをなくしちゃったの。捜すの手伝ってくれない？
english: I've lost my pen. Will you help me look for it?

japanese: またあったのね？
english: It's happened again, hasn't it?

japanese: それは予想だにしない展開だった。
english: That was an unexpected development.

japanese: 何の科目を勉強してるの？
english: What subject are you studying?

japanese: 何の教科を勉強してるの？
english: What subject are you studying?

japanese: 思いもよらない体験をしました。
english: I had an experience I never thought I'd have.

japanese: 料理は苦手です。
english: I'm not good at cooking.

japanese: 予想だにしない経験をしました。
english: I had an experience I never thought I'd have.

japanese: 「三度目の正直になるか？ならないか？」「ブブー。外れ。なりませんでした。悪しからず」
english: "Third time's the charm? No?" "Err err. Wrong. Guess not. Sorry."

japanese: 制限速度ってある？
english: Is there a speed limit?

japanese: 彼は５４歳で亡くなりました。
english: He died aged 54.

japanese: 誰にでも欠点はある。それでいいのよ。
english: Everyone is imperfect, and that's OK.

japanese: 誰にでも至らないところはあるものよ。それでいいのよ。
english: Everyone is imperfect, and that's OK.

japanese: どんな宗教も、人と同じようにこの世に良いことも悪いことをももたらしてきた。
english: Every religion, like every person, has brought good and bad things into the world.

japanese: どの宗教も、人と同じように一利あれば一害ありさ。
english: Every religion, like every person, has brought good and bad things into the world.

japanese: 出世払いで構わないよ。
english: I don't care about being paid back.

japanese: なんとかコンサートのチケットを２枚、手に入れることができた。
english: I managed to get two tickets for the concert.

japanese: 信号は青だったよ。
english: The traffic light was green.

japanese: なんなら、私抜きで行けば。
english: If you want, go without me.

japanese: 全て順調だと思ったのに。
english: I thought everything went well.

japanese: 知らない人に名前を教えちゃダメよ。
english: Don't tell strangers your name.

japanese: この本は僕には読みやすかった。
english: This book was easy for me to read.

japanese: この本は、私にとっては読みやすかったです。
english: This book was easy for me to read.

japanese: トムは通勤ラッシュの時間帯に運転をしてたんだ。
english: Tom was driving during rush hour.

japanese: ボールをキャッチしろ！
english: Catch the ball!

japanese: あいつが言うことって、分かりづらいよなぁ。
english: It's hard to understand what he's saying.

japanese: 多分、午後には着くさ。
english: He will probably arrive in the afternoon.

japanese: 私たちは口で息をし、食べ、話します。
english: We breathe, eat, and speak with our mouth.

japanese: 両親が空港まで一緒に来てくれました。
english: My parents accompanied me to the airport.

japanese: 気づくのが遅すぎました。
english: I found out too late.

japanese: この手紙、出しといてもらえる？
english: Could you send this letter for me?

japanese: 笑顔の方が素敵だよ。
english: The way you smile is wonderful.

japanese: この手紙、ポストに落としといて。
english: Drop these letters in the mailbox.

japanese: トムの犬は吠えたりしないよ。
english: Tom's dog never barks.

japanese: トムの犬は、絶対に吠えない。
english: Tom's dog never barks.

japanese: 今日、僕の学校に銃乱射予告があったんだよ。
english: There was a school shooter threat at my school today.

japanese: 今日、僕の学校に爆破予告のメールが届いたらしい。
english: It seems that my school received a bomb threat today.

japanese: 思ったことを気兼ねなく言っていいんだよ。
english: Feel free to share your thoughts.

japanese: トムは目に涙を浮かべて帰ってきた。
english: Tom came home with tears in his eyes.

japanese: トムは、私のもとを訪ねた。
english: Tom came to visit me.

japanese: 最近トムが訪ねてきたんだ。
english: Tom came to visit me recently.

japanese: 近道、知ってるよ。ついておいで。
english: I know a shortcut. Follow me.

japanese: うちのキャンパスでは、少なくとも年に一度は震災訓練があるよ。
english: On our campus, we have earthquake drills at least once a year.

japanese: 本校では、教職員を対象に不審者対応訓練を行っています。
english: At this school, our faculty members are trained in how to deal with suspicious persons.

japanese: 私だったら、家に帰って昼寝するよ。
english: If I were you, I'd go home and take a nap.

japanese: 僕だったら、家に戻ってひと寝入りするよ。
english: If I were you, I'd go home and take a nap.

japanese: 太陽を描く時って、何色を使う？
english: What color do you use when you paint the sun?

japanese: ５歳より下の子はタダだよ。
english: Children under age five are free.

japanese: ５歳未満のお子様は無料です。
english: Children under age five are free.

japanese: トムはこれまで食洗機を使ったことがなかった。
english: Tom hasn't used a dishwasher before.

japanese: ハンガーストライキをしています。
english: I'm on a hunger strike.

japanese: ハンスト中です。
english: I'm on a hunger strike.

japanese: この講堂は300人まで入れる。
english: This auditorium can seat up to 300 people.

japanese: トムは表面上はいつも穏やかです。
english: Tom is always outwardly calm.

japanese: トムは私と同じぐらいの歳よ。
english: Tom is around my age.

japanese: 「ねぇ、ゲームしよう」「あれ？課題するんじゃなかったの？」「そうなんだけど、したくないんだもん」
english: "Hey, let's play." "But I thought you had homework to do?" "Yeah, but I don't want to do it."

japanese: 楽な方に流されて生きてると、いつか後悔するよ。
english: If you don't keep your guard up in life, one day you'll regret it.

japanese: 楽な方に流されて生きてると、私みたいになるよ。
english: If you live always taking easy way, you'll become like me.

japanese: お金があれば、やりたいことはいくらでもあるさ。
english: There's a lot I would do if I had the money.

japanese: 頼むからついてこないで。
english: Please don't follow me.

japanese: お願いだから付いてこないで。
english: Please don't follow me.

japanese: 猫の手も借りたいくらい忙しいんだよ。
english: We're so busy we'll take any help we can get.

japanese: 窓際の人って、あなたの上司？
english: Is that your boss by the window?

japanese: トムは私と同世代よ。
english: Tom and I are the same generation.

japanese: 次やったら、お尻ペンペンしますよ。
english: If you do that again, I'll spank you.

japanese: またやったら、お尻を引っ叩くわよ。
english: If you do that again, I'll spank you.

japanese: １杯のコーヒーで、頭がクリアになる。
english: With a cup of coffee your head becomes clear.

japanese: 日本酒は飲めません。
english: I am not able to drink Japanese wine.

japanese: 間違いをこれみよがしに指摘する人っているよね。
english: There are people that make a show out of pointing out other's mistakes.

japanese: どうして今日はうちに寄ってくれなかったの？
english: Why didn't you stop by my place today?

japanese: 今日は、私の所に寄っていきませんか？
english: Why don't you stop by my place today?

japanese: 風はどこからやって来るの？
english: Where does wind come from?

japanese: 新年はどこで迎えたい？
english: Where do you want to celebrate New Year?

japanese: 封筒を開けました。
english: I opened the envelope.

japanese: もう１つ枕をください。
english: Please give me an extra pillow.

japanese: お手本見せてくれたらやるよ。
english: I'll do it if you show me how.

japanese: この写真を見ると、学生時代を思い出すなぁ。
english: When I look at this photograph, it reminds me of my student years.

japanese: 象形文字を読むのは難しいです。
english: Reading hieroglyphs is difficult.

japanese: 彼女は子育てについて、彼と言い争った。
english: She argued with him about raising children.

japanese: 今の段階では、何も言えません。
english: At this stage, I cannot say anything.

japanese: すみません。お手洗いをお借りしてもよろしいですか？
english: Excuse me. May I use your bathroom?

japanese: 彼女はジョンに手紙を書きました。
english: She wrote a letter to John.

japanese: 彼ね、この泉の水を飲んだのよ。
english: He drank water from this spring.

japanese: 他の枕もお願いします。
english: Please give me another pillow.

japanese: 妻に先立たれた夫は、深い悲しみに包まれた。
english: After the death of his wife, he fell into a deep grief.

japanese: 他の枕をお願いします。
english: A different pillow, please.

japanese: 「わぁ。シャツが後ろ前になってる。ちょっと、気付いてたでしょ？何で教えてくれないの？こんな格好で子供たちに偉そうに説教しちゃったよ」「いやぁ、『知らぬが仏』って言葉もあるし。黙っとく方がいいかなぁと思って」
english: "Eep, my shirt's on backward! Hold on, you already knew, didn't you? Why didn't you tell me? I literally just gave a big lecture looking like this!" "Well, they say ignorance is bliss. I just figured it'd be best if I didn't say anything."

japanese: 長年にわたる努力が実を結び、トムは司法試験に合格することができました。
english: Tom's many years of hard work paid off, and he was able to pass the bar exam.

japanese: トムって、大きなクマのぬいぐるみみたい。
english: Tom is like a big teddy bear.

japanese: トムはフレンチトーストを作ってるよ。
english: Tom is making some french toast.

japanese: トムはそれをメアリーに説明しなくてはいけません。
english: Tom needs to explain that to Mary.

japanese: 顔にインクが付いてるよ。
english: You have some ink on your face.

japanese: その失敗がトムを意気消沈させています。
english: The failure depressed Tom.

japanese: サルが、私たちが乗ってるバスの前に飛び出してきたのよ。
english: A monkey ran out in front of our bus.

japanese: これは無料のサービスですよ。
english: This is a free service.

english: "I've brought Mei up by my own hand. You think I'd give her up so easily to some stranger from who knows where? If you want to marry her, bring me a statement of your qualifications." "Of course. I've brought it with me." "Give it to me. Huh. Academic background: Tatoeba Medical School, graduate. Place of work: Tatoeba General Hospital. Position: Assistant Professor." "Well then, come on in. Hey, bring some sake! On the double!"

japanese: 「うちのかわいい冬彦ちゃんを、あんなろくに挨拶もできないよう小娘と結婚させれるわけないでしょ。あなたから、はっきり言ってやってください」「そうだな。まぁ、いいんじゃないか？かわいいし」「いくありません。顔は関係ありません」「まぁ、そんなかっかするな。お前だって、昔は毎晩のようにディスコに行ってブイブイ言わしてたんだし」「それとこれとは別です」「同じだよ。馬鹿馬鹿しい。早く、子離れしろ」
english: "I'm not going to let my sweet Fuyuhiko get married to a little girl who doesn't even have basic manners. Tell him that for me." "It's not so bad. I mean, she's cute." "No, she's not. And looks don't matter." "Well, don't get all worked up about it. You used to go to the disco every night and live it up, partying hard." "That's different." "It's the same thing! This is ridiculous. You need to learn to let things go."

japanese: キーボードは、汚い。
english: The keyboard is filthy.

japanese: 月が雲に隠れて見えなくなっちゃった。
english: The moon disappeared behind the clouds.

japanese: お二人のプロ意識に敬意を表します。
english: I salute both of you for your professionalism.

japanese: 「『~たら』形なんか、大嫌いだ。意味が分からないよ」「if ... then とか when とか after とか、そんな感じだよ」「あっ。分かった。でも、まだ好きじゃない」「何が嫌なの？」「何でもない」
english: "I hate the '～たら' ​form in Japanese. I just don't get it." "It means something like 'if so-and-so, then so-and-so', or 'when so-and-so', or 'after so-and-so', and stuff like that." "Ah, got it. But I still don't like it." "What don't you like?" "Never mind."

japanese: 期末試験は来週だよ。
english: Our finals are next week.

japanese: 期末テストって、いつなの？
english: When are your final exams?

japanese: 顔に何つけてるの？
english: What is on your face?

japanese: 親父は職人気質な人でね。
english: My dad is a stubborn man at his job.

japanese: トムは毎日一生懸命働いてるよ。
english: Tom works hard every day.

japanese: 騒ぐな。
english: Don't be noisy.

japanese: 最初の角を左に曲がって。
english: Take a left at the first corner.

japanese: 「動物園にはどうやって行ったの？」「電車とバスを乗り継いで行ったよ」
english: "How did you get to the zoo?" "I rode the train, and then the bus."

japanese: 卵を落とさないように気をつけてね。
english: Be careful not to drop the eggs.

japanese: よそ者扱いするのは止めてよ。
english: Quit treating me like an outsider.

japanese: ここで待ってろ！
english: Wait here!

japanese: 「フランス語が上手ね」って言われるようじゃぁ、まだまだね。
english: When someone tells you "Your French is so good", it means you've still got a ways to go.

japanese: あの人たちが、私を殺そうとしたの。
english: Those people tried to kill me.

japanese: 「どうやったら、もっと上手く言えるんだろう」って、考えるのが楽しいんだ。
english: It's fun to think about ways you can say things better.

japanese: 芽衣さんのお墨付きがもらえるなんて、すごく嬉しいです。
english: I'm really glad Mei gave me her endorsement.

japanese: 大きな花は黄色いです。
english: The big flower is yellow.

japanese: はぁ？極みの野郎、ほんとキモっ。何でもかんでも包丁にしてるよ。
english: That Kiwami guy sure is weird, huh? He makes knives out of everything.

japanese: きわみのやつ気持ち悪いな。あらゆるものをナイフにしてる。
english: That Kiwami guy sure is weird, huh? He makes knives out of everything.

japanese: メアリーはミニスカートが好きです。
english: Mary likes miniskirts.

japanese: 好きな人の話、聞かせて！
english: Let me hear the story of the person you like!

japanese: 見てるだけで、よだれが出そう。
english: Just looking at the food made my mouth water.

japanese: 僕たちはみんな、同じ孤児院で育ったんだ。
english: We all grew up in the same orphanage.

japanese: 庭に赤い花がたくさん咲いてるよ。
english: There are a lot of red flowers in the garden.

japanese: Tatoebaって、まるで伝言ゲームのようですね。
english: Tatoeba is exactly like Telephone.

japanese: ぶんぶんマグネットは面白い音をしてるよ。
english: Buzzing Magnets make a funny noise.

japanese: かくれんぼのルールが分からない。
english: I don't know how to play hide-and-seek.

japanese: かくれんぼのやり方が分からないんだよ。
english: I don't know how to play hide-and-seek.

japanese: よくあることだから、気にしてないわ。
english: That happens often, so I don't worry about it.

japanese: 新しく買った服をきると気分が上がるよね。
english: Putting on new clothes cheers me up.

japanese: 僕のお兄ちゃん、運転できるし。
english: My big brother can drive.

japanese: お父さんとお母さんに、よろしくね。
english: Say hello to your parents for me.

japanese: 子どもの頃、休みの日につまらないと思ったことなど一度もないよ。
english: As a kid, I was never bored in the holidays.

japanese: 次のバスって、いつ来るかわかる？
english: Do you know when the next bus is coming?

japanese: 君の笑顔にはかなわないな。
english: I'm no match for your smile.

japanese: かくれんぼって、どうやるの？
english: How is hide-and-seek played?

japanese: 「秘密を守ってくれる？」「わかった」「僕も守るよ」
english: "Can you keep it a secret?" "OK." "I will, too."

japanese: 今朝の最低気温は、－１度。日中でも７度までしか上がりません。あたたかくしてお出かけください。
english: This morning's low temperature was -1 degree. The temperature will only go up to 7 degrees during the day. Please dress warmly when you go out.

japanese: マニュアルにとらわれず、柔軟に対応していくことも大切です。
english: Instead of limiting yourself to the manual, it's also important that you adapt.

japanese: 日本の建前と本音という概念は、僕にとって、互いに嘘をついてるだけだと思う。表面的なものだけじゃない？本当は？気持ちを傷つけないためと分かってても、やっぱりあまり好きじゃない。
english: To me, the Japanese concept of "tatemae to honne" is just about lying to each other. Isn't it overly superficial? What about sincerity? I know it's about being considerate of others' feelings, but I still don't really like it.

japanese: 明日は雨だって思ってるかもしれないけど、きっと晴れるよ。
english: You probably think it'll rain tomorrow, but it'll most likely be sunny.

japanese: 初めはさ、家の仕事を継ぐ気はさらさらなかったんだ。
english: At first, I didn't intend to take over the family business.

japanese: 私、よそ者だから、この辺のことあまり詳しくないのよ。
english: I'm not from around here, so I don't know this area well.

japanese: 建前は「嘘」と誤解されがちですが、それは「嘘」のように「人を騙そうとするもの」ではなく「相手との意見の相違を、相手に不快感を与えず伝えるための手段の一つ」だと私は考えています。討論することを敬遠しがちな日本人が、円滑に物事を進めていけるようにと根付いた文化だと思います。
english: The concept of "Tatemae" tends to be misunderstood as lying. But I think it's not lying in the sense of deceiving others, but rather as a way of respecting others' differences in opinion without making them uncomfortable. It's a cultural aspect stemming from how Japanese people tend to avoid arguments in favor of keeping the peace.

japanese: これ、来週に延期しない？
english: Why don't we postpone this until next week?

japanese: メアリーって、何でああもトゲのある言い方するんだろうね？
english: I wonder why Mary always talks that harshly.

japanese: そう思うのは、心の持ちようだと思います。
english: I think that belief depends on good attitude.

japanese: 自分にやましい事があるから、そう聞こえるんだと思うよ。
english: I think it sounds that way because there's something wrong with me.

japanese: ママ、うんちしたい。
english: Mom, I have to poop.

japanese: 彼女はレンズ豆のサラダを作りました。
english: She made a lentil salad.

japanese: シューズに名前を書くときは、かかとに書いてください。
english: When you write my name on the shoes, please do it on the heel.

japanese: 持参する靴は、かかとのあるモノにしてください。
english: Please bring shoes with a thick sole.

japanese: かあさん、この靴ね、裏から水が染みてくるんだけど、新しいの買ってよ。
english: Mom, I need some new shoes. Water leaks through the soles on these ones.

japanese: 「一日中何してんの？」「食べてる」
english: "What do you do all day?" "I eat."

japanese: 笑われちゃったよ。
english: I was laughed at.

japanese: なんでまだ起きてるの？３時だよ？
english: What are you doing up? It's three in the morning.

japanese: この場合、どうするのが一番いいんだろう？
english: What's the best thing to do in this case?

japanese: あなたに怒ってるんじゃないの。自分によ。
english: I'm not mad at you. I'm mad at myself.

japanese: あなたに腹を立ててるわけけじゃないのよ。自分に腹が立つの。
english: I'm not mad at you. I'm mad at myself.

japanese: 水温は３８度です。
english: The water's 38 degrees.

japanese: 水の温度は38℃です。
english: The water's 38 degrees.

japanese: 訓練すれば、女の子だって立っておしっこできます。
english: With practice, even girls can pee standing up.

japanese: ついつい口を滑らしちゃってさ、この間トムと映画を見に行ったの、彼氏にばれちゃった。
english: I accidentally let it slip to my boyfriend that I'd gone to a movie with Tom the other day.

japanese: この金で月末まで持たせないとな。
english: This money needs to last us until the end of the month.

japanese: この講座って、いい？
english: Is this course good?

japanese: 雨のせいで、道路がすごく滑りやすいんだ。
english: The road is really slippery because of the rain.

japanese: 今日、Duolingoのレッスンはしましたか？
english: Did you do your Duolingo lesson today?

japanese: 今日、Duolingoはやった？
english: Did you do your Duolingo lesson today?

japanese: サンタクロースって、プレゼントを全部、袋の中に入れて運んでるんだよ。
english: Santa Claus carries all the presents in his sack.

japanese: その点については、トムと意見が分かれました。
english: Tom and I disagreed on that point.

japanese: 今年の夏は、例年にない暑さだ。
english: This summer is unusually hot.

japanese: 僕たち、よく学校をサボってます。
english: We often bunk off school.

japanese: 今日、ママがアップルパイを作ったんだ。
english: Mum made some apple pie today.

japanese: ママがね、今日アップルパイを焼いたんだ。
english: Mum baked an apple pie today.

japanese: 先週は雪でした。
english: It snowed last week.

japanese: クマが好きなんだ。
english: I like bears.

japanese: 数学の宿題はすんだ？
english: Is your math homework done?

japanese: 算数の宿題は終わった？
english: Is your math homework done?

japanese: 彼の手のぬくもりが忘れられません。
english: I'll never forget the warmth of his hands.

japanese: くまのプーさんは、私が一番好きなディズニーのキャラクターなんだ。
english: Winnie the Pooh is my favourite Disney cartoon character.

japanese: 凍え死んじゃうよ。そこの窓閉めてよ。
english: I'm freezing to death. Close that window.

japanese: 人の言うことなんて気にするなよ。
english: Don't worry about what people say.

japanese: 後者の方が前者よりもいいよ。
english: The latter is better than the former.

japanese: 彼は子供が好きそうだよ。
english: He seems like he likes kids.

japanese: カメラを持ってればなぁ。
english: I wish I'd had my camera with me.

japanese: カメラ、持ってくればよかった。
english: I wish I'd had my camera with me.

japanese: 二時半まで待っといて。
english: Wait until 2:30.

japanese: ２時半まで待って。
english: Wait until 2:30.

japanese: スペイン語も話しますよ。
english: I also speak Spanish.

japanese: 外には行けなかった。
english: I couldn't go outside.

japanese: 「今日はどれぐらい泳いでたの？」「朝の９時から昼の３時までだよ」
english: "How long did you swim today?" "From 9 in the morning till 3 in the afternoon."

japanese: 箸の持ち方が分かりません。
english: I don't understand the way to hold chopsticks.

japanese: この理論は信じないよ。
english: I do not believe in this theory.

japanese: この文を訳したいんだけど、この単語の意味が分からないの。もし、よかったら教えて。
english: I want to translate this sentence, but I don't know what this word means. Can you explain it to me?

japanese: 今、ビールが飲みたい。
english: Now, I want to drink beer.

japanese: なんとかなるさ。
english: We'll manage somehow.

japanese: 消しゴム貸してくれる？
english: Can you lend me your rubber?

japanese: 地球の半径は、約6,000キロです。
english: The radius of the Earth is about six thousand kilometres.

japanese: チョコが買いたかったの。
english: I wanted to buy some chocolate.

japanese: チョコレートが買いたかったんだ。
english: I wanted to buy some chocolate.

japanese: 以前どこかで拝見しました。
english: I've seen them somewhere before.

japanese: 前にどっかで見たことがある。
english: I've seen them somewhere before.

japanese: トムは、難しい問題はスラスラ解けるのに、九九とか簡単な計算が苦手なんだよ。
english: Tom can solve difficult problems with ease, but he is weak when it comes to simple arithmetic such as the times table.

japanese: 今日は誰と泳いだの？
english: Who did you swim with today?

japanese: あの個性豊かな５人が酒を酌み交わしているところを想像すると、楽しいね。
english: It's fun to imagine those five eccentrics drinking together.

japanese: あなたとは釣りに行かない。
english: I'm not going to go fishing with you.

japanese: ３０分ほど手伝ってくれない？
english: Can you help me for half an hour?

japanese: トムは、ラーメンが大好きです。
english: Tom loves ramen.

japanese: 私はトムの歌を初めて聞いた時のことを決して忘れません。
english: I'll never forget the first time I heard Tom sing.

japanese: 明日、動物園に行くの。そこで、いろんな動物に会えるよ。
english: Tomorrow, we're going to the zoo, and we'll see all kinds of animals there.

japanese: それがあった時、誰といたの？
english: Who was with you when that happened?

japanese: 英語をもっと頑張って、みんなと肩を並べて話ができるようになりたいと思っています。
english: I want to work harder on my English so that I can make conversation on the same level as everyone else.

japanese: 家族そろって、どこ行くの？
english: Where will all the family go?

japanese: クリスマスは、家族みんなで過ごします。
english: I spend Christmas together with my whole family.

japanese: クリスマスは、家族が勢揃いしました。
english: The whole family got together for Christmas.

japanese: フランス語でラブレター書ける？
english: Can you write a love letter in French?

japanese: 誕生日に何かプレゼントしたいんだけど。
english: I'd like to get you something for your birthday.

japanese: 誕生日に何かあげたいんだけど。
english: I'd like to get you something for your birthday.

japanese: 人の人生に、いい影響を与えることができるだろうか？
english: Will I ever make an impact in someone else's life?

japanese: クリスマス会は中止になったんだ。
english: The Christmas party was cancelled.

japanese: 何考えてるのかな？
english: I wonder what he's thinking.

japanese: 彼女、何を考えてるのかしら？
english: I wonder what she's thinking.

japanese: うわぁ、今、ロボットが歩いてるの見た？スーパー・クロム・5000だったに違いないよ！
english: Wow, did you just see that robot walk by? It must have been Super Chrome 5000!

japanese: メアリーが、トムのほっぺにキスしたんだ。
english: Mary kissed Tom on the cheek.

japanese: メアリーはトムの頬にキスをしました。
english: Mary kissed Tom on the cheek.

japanese: それって、本物の木？
english: Is it a real tree?

japanese: トムはプロのスノーボーダーなんだ。
english: Tom is a professional snowboarder.

japanese: 誰にも見られないように注意しろよ。
english: Be careful that no one sees you.

japanese: トムはな、ウインタースポーツが好きなんだよ。
english: Tom likes winter sports.

japanese: ロンドンの西に位置する町です。
english: The town is to the west of London.

japanese: メアリーはウインタースポーツが好きなんだ。
english: Mary likes winter sports.

japanese: 「メアリーって、彼女なの？」「違うよ。連れだよ」「ふーん。でも二人が抱き合ってるところ見たよ」「友達とハグしたりしない？」
english: "Is Mary your girlfriend?" "No, we're mates." "Yeah, but I've seen how you two hug each other." "Don't you ever hug your friends?"

japanese: まだピンとこないな。
english: It still doesn't ring a bell.

japanese: 病気の時に、得意な言語以外で話す気力なんてないよ。
english: When I'm sick, I don't have the energy to speak in any other language than my main one.

japanese: だって、クリスマスだから家族の時間だもん。僕が暇だったら、遊ぼうね。
english: It's Christmas, so it's family time. But let's play when I have time.

japanese: 「今夜も、ネットゲームで遊ぼうよ」「今夜は、無理かも......」「どうして？」「だって、クリスマスだから家族の時間だもん。僕が暇だったら、遊ぼうね」「うん。わかった」
english: "Are we going to play again tonight?" "Maybe not tonight..." "Why not?" "It's Christmas, so it's family time. But let's play when I have time." "All right then."

japanese: 僕のこと忘れないって約束してくれる？
english: Do you promise not to forget me?

japanese: サンタさんに「英語が上手になる魔法の薬」をお願いしたら、届けてくれるかな？
english: If I ask Santa for a magic potion that makes me good at English, will he give it to me?

japanese: 僕のこと忘れないって、約束して。
english: Promise that you won't forget me.

japanese: お願い、私のこと忘れないって約束して。
english: Please promise me that you won't forget me.

japanese: スーツケースを買ってあげようっと。
english: I'll buy him a suitcase.

japanese: ママが買ってくれたピアノが、昨日届いたんだ。
english: My mom bought me a piano, and it arrived yesterday.

japanese: U ターン禁止です。
english: U-turns are prohibited.

japanese: Ｕターン禁止よ。
english: No U-turns.

japanese: 心配するな。まだ、時間はたっぷりある。
english: Don't worry. There's still plenty of time.

japanese: やめといた方がいいって。
english: You shouldn't do it.

japanese: 「彼女と結婚するつもりなんだ」「やめといた方がいいよ」
english: "I'm going to marry her." "You shouldn't."

japanese: 英語が話せないのよ。
english: I can't speak English.

japanese: トムは、自分の子供たちには弁護士や医者になってほしいと思っている。
english: Tom wants his kids to become lawyers and doctors.

japanese: トムはメアリーに何をあげたと思う？
english: Guess what Tom gave Mary.

japanese: なんでみんな、そんな忙しいの？
english: Why is everybody so busy?

japanese: どうしてみんな、そんなバタバタしてるの？
english: Why is everybody so busy?

japanese: トムもメアリーもコーヒーを注文したの？
english: Did both Tom and Mary order coffee?

japanese: ジョンは、日本でソフトウェア会社のマネージャーをしていました。彼はハワイ出身の日本人で、カッコよくて色黒。がっちりとした体つきでした。
english: Jon was a manager in the software company in Japan. He was a Japanese from Hawaii. He was handsome and dark. He had a well-built body.

japanese: ジョンは、日本にあるソフト会社でマネージャーをしてたよ。ハワイ出身の日本人で、ハンサムで色黒。いい体格をしてたよ。
english: Jon was a manager in the software company in Japan. He was a Japanese from Hawaii. He was handsome and dark. He had a well-built body.

japanese: 一人で留守番してたの？
english: Did you stay at home alone?

japanese: トムの全てを愛してたのよ。
english: I loved Tom completely.

japanese: 今朝は耐え難いほど寒い。
english: It is unbearably cold this morning.

japanese: 子供は冬でも半ズボンを穿く。
english: The children wear short pants even in the winter.

japanese: 部屋の換気扇を回すとドアの隙間から冷たい風が入り込んでくる。
english: When I turn the fan on in the room, a cool breeze comes in from under the door.

japanese: ちょっと黙ってくれる？
english: Could you just shut up for a bit?

japanese: ケータイの充電し忘れた。
english: I forgot to charge my cellphone.

japanese: やばい、電池がもう切れる。
english: Shoot, my battery's low.

japanese: 頭がかゆい。
english: My head is itchy.

japanese: 背中がかゆい。
english: My back is itchy.

japanese: 部屋がごちゃごちゃしている。
english: The room's a mess.

japanese: 子供の泣き声が遠くから聞こえてくる。
english: The sound of children crying can be heard in the distance.

japanese: 雨の匂いがする。
english: It smells like rain.

japanese: パトカーが犯人の車をけたたましいサイレンを鳴らしながら追跡する。
english: A police car chases after the criminal with its siren wailing.

japanese: 早くコロナが収束して前みたいにライブに行きたいものだ。
english: I want COVID to be over already so I can go to live concerts like I did before.

japanese: 少年は重たい大きな本を持って来た。
english: The boy brought a big, heavy book.

japanese: 僕、なんでいつもいつもドジっちゃうんだろう？ちゃんとできないかな？
english: Why do I always screw things up? Can't I do anything right?

japanese: 最悪な人でも変われると思う？
english: Do you think even the worst person can change?

japanese: アメリカ英語を話します。
english: He speaks American English.

japanese: この２つは似ています。
english: These two are similar.

japanese: フランス語を話そうとすると、頭が真っ白になっちゃう。
english: Whenever I try to speak French, my mind goes blank.

japanese: これぞ日本男児！
english: This is a Japanese man!

japanese: 私の説明は事足りなかったわ。ごめんね。
english: My explanation wasn't good enough. I'm sorry about that.

japanese: 夜空に星が瞬いていた。
english: Stars were twinkling in the night sky.

japanese: 手袋が濡れちゃった。
english: My gloves got wet.

japanese: 「男らしさ」って何？ そんな言葉、僕たちの辞書にはないし。
english: What's "manliness"? That word's not in our dictionaries.

japanese: 「女らしさ」って何？そんな言葉、私の辞書にないし。
english: What's "femininity"? That word's not in my dictionary.

japanese: 赤ちゃんのあんよって、ぷにょぷにょしてて気持ちいいよね。
english: The baby's tootsies feel nice and soft, don't they?

japanese: 隣の赤ちゃん、あんよし始めたよ。
english: The neighbor's baby has started toddling about.

japanese: 隣の赤ちゃん、よちよち歩きし始めたよ。
english: The neighbor's baby has started to toddle.

japanese: 「色々ありがとう！」「こちらこそ！」
english: "Thanks a lot!" "My pleasure!"

japanese: 「本当にありがとう！」「どういたしまして！」
english: "Thanks a lot!" "My pleasure!"

japanese: 食わず嫌いで寿司を敬遠する人もいますが、何度か食べるうちに「寿司の虜になった」という人も結構多いですよ。
english: There are those who distance themselves from sushi without having ever tried it, but there are also a fair number of people who have "Become captive to sushi" having only tried it a few times.

japanese: 「美味しそうな蒲鉾みっけ。食べていい？」「ダメよ。お節用なんだから」「けち」
english: “Ooh, those fish cakes look tasty! Can I try them?” “No, don’t! They’re for New Year’s!” “Jeez, stingy much?”

japanese: 子どもたちは嬉しそうだったよ。
english: The children looked happy.

japanese: 子どもたちは退屈そうだったよ。
english: The children looked bored.

japanese: 子どもたちはつまらなさそうだったよ。
english: The children looked bored.

japanese: 子どもたちは興味深げだったよ。
english: The children looked interested.

japanese: 彼女の息が髪に当たってくすぐったかった。
english: I was tickled by her breath against my hair.

japanese: 私、また間違えちゃった？
english: Did I make a mistake again?

japanese: それいいね。トムも気に入ると思うよ。
english: I like it. I think Tom does, too.

japanese: お腹が痛いので今日は休みます。
english: I have a stomachache, so I'll take the day off.

japanese: 虫の音が庭から聞こえてくる。
english: Insect sounds are coming from the garden.

japanese: テレビは意外と電気をくう。
english: Televisions use more electricity than you might expect.

japanese: リモコンを探しているんだけど、どこにあるか知らない？
english: I'm looking for the remote control. Do you know where it is?

japanese: 監視カメラによって人々の一挙手一投足が見張られている。
english: Because of security cameras, everyone's every move is being watched.

japanese: よし、行こうか。
english: Well, shall we move?

japanese: よっしゃあ！勝った！
english: Alright! I won!

japanese: ごめん、よく聞こえない。
english: Sorry, I can't hear you well.

japanese: 今日は天気がいいので洗濯物をたくさん干した。
english: Since the weather today is good, I hung a lot of the laundry out to dry.

japanese: 彼は努力を惜しまない立派な人だ。
english: He is a fine man who spares no effort.

japanese: 最近スマホの調子が悪い。
english: My phone has been having some performance issues recently.

japanese: この地区は高齢者が多い。
english: There are many senior citizens in this area.

japanese: 最近地元に新しい施設がオープンした。
english: New facilities opened recently in the local area.

japanese: 妖怪なんているわけないじゃないか。バカだな。
english: Of course there's no such thing as yokai. You're such an idiot.

japanese: 近くに安いものを売っているスーパーとかありますか。
english: Is there a supermarket nearby that sells inexpensive items?

japanese: コップに女の口紅のあとが残っている。
english: The stain of the woman's lipstick remains on the cup.

japanese: 最近DIYにはまっている。
english: Recently I got into DIY.

japanese: 先にトイレ行っといで。
english: Please use the bathroom beforehand.

japanese: トイレが見つからない。
english: I can't find the bathroom.

japanese: きれいでちゃんとしたトイレだった。
english: The toilets were immaculate.

japanese: ホテルのトイレはきれいだ。
english: The hotel's toilet is clean.

japanese: 手入れの行き届いていないのがすぐに分かる。
english: That it was not properly cared for was immediately apparent.

japanese: 頭を掻いて誤魔化すのが彼の癖だ。
english: He has a habit of scratching his head when he wants to avoid answering things.

japanese: ダメだダメだと言われ続けてもへこたれない。
english: Even when people keep telling me it can't be done, I won't give up.

japanese: 彼ってなんていうか、その、独特だよね。
english: You know, he's really - how do I put it - unique, isn't he?

japanese: どう考えてもおかしいだろ。
english: It's suspicious no matter how you think about it.

japanese: 家に帰るまでが遠足です。
english: The trip isn't over until you get back home.

japanese: ちょっと休ませてくれ。
english: I'll let you rest for a bit.

japanese: 中学受験をする小学生の人数が近年増えている。
english: The number of elementary school students taking junior high school entrance exams has increased in recent years.

japanese: 早く外に出て思いっきり遊びたい。
english: I want to hurry and go out, so I can let loose and have fun.

japanese: 冬のヨーロッパは寒い。
english: Europe is cold in the winter.

japanese: 彼は受験に失敗してからひどくぐれてしまった。
english: Ever since he failed the entrance exam, he's been really headed down the wrong path.

japanese: 電車旅が好きだ。
english: I like train trips.

japanese: 展望台から遠くの街が霞んで見える。
english: From the observation platform, you can just barely make out the town in the distance.

japanese: 山頂は思いのほか涼しくて気持ちが良かった。
english: The summit was surprisingly nice.

japanese: 滑りやすいのでご注意ください。
english: Please be careful of the slippery surface.

japanese: 挨拶は元気に大きな声でしましょう。
english: When greeting, you should use a big and energetic voice.

japanese: 目も当てられない状況だ。
english: The situation is too terrible to look at.

japanese: もう結構ですからお帰りください。
english: I've heard enough already. Please leave.

japanese: いいから、言うことを聞けよ。
english: Just listen to what I'm saying, already.

japanese: 彼は、中学で英語を教えている。
english: He teaches English at a middle school.

japanese: 市の防災行政無線放送が聞こえる。
english: The city's disaster prevention radio broadcast can be heard.

japanese: 地元の消防局からお知らせを受け取った。
english: I received word from the local fire station.

japanese: 火災の予防に努める。
english: We're working to prevent fires.

japanese: ドラマをNetflixでイッキ見する。
english: Watch drama series straight on Netflix.

japanese: 勝てば天国、負ければ即死。
english: If you win you'll be in heaven, if you lose it's certain death.

japanese: 気象庁は注意を呼びかけている。
english: The Meteorological Agency is urging caution.

japanese: 強い冬型の気圧配置となり、雪が強まるおそれがある。
english: There's a fear that the snow will strengthen amid the strong winter pressure pattern.

japanese: 積雪の影響で配達に遅れが生じている。
english: Delays in deliveries are occurring due to accumulated snow.

japanese: 冬はあっというまに日が暮れる。
english: In winter the sun goes down in the blink of an eye.

japanese: 新しいセーターを買った。
english: I bought a new sweater.

japanese: 今日は仕事納めだ。
english: Today is the last day of work.

japanese: 二人はこの道を通ってやってきました。
english: The two of them went down this road.

japanese: 警察は捜査を進めている。
english: The police are conducting an investigation.

japanese: 雪による事故が各地で相次いでいます。
english: Snow-caused incidents continue to happen widespread.

japanese: 記録的積雪を観測している。
english: We're seeing record amounts of snow.

japanese: 渋滞から脱出するのに3時間かかった。
english: It took me three hours to get out of the traffic jam.

japanese: あんまり顔を見せる機会もない。
english: I don't get the chance to show my face much.

japanese: ベビーカーを押す人が目の前を通って行った。
english: A person pushing a stroller passed right in front of me.

japanese: いいね、この作り。
english: This is a nice craft.

japanese: 予定を確認して下さい。
english: Please confirm your reservation.

japanese: 千円引きってかなりお得じゃない？
english: A thousand yen discount is a pretty great deal, no?

japanese: よく分かんないや。
english: I don't really get it.

japanese: 我ながら、見よう見まねで縫った浴衣は、なかなかの仕上がりでした。
english: If you'll let me say so myself, I think the yukata I sewed through copying someone else turned out quite a success.

japanese: テレビを見る若者は減ってきている。
english: There have been less and less young people who watch TV.

japanese: ラッキーなことに、お母さんはすぐに賛成してくれた。
english: Luckily, my mom agreed right away.

japanese: ここであきらめるの？
english: Are you going to give up here?

japanese: 大丈夫。君ならできる。
english: It'll be fine. I know you have what it takes.

japanese: エアコンの調子が悪い。
english: The air conditioner is in a bad condition.

japanese: 昨日のあの番組見た？
english: Did you see that show yesterday?

japanese: 来年の目標はなんですか。
english: What are your goals for next year?

japanese: 今日もうまく彼女と話せなかった。
english: I couldn't talk with her well today either.

japanese: 眩しくて目を開けられない。
english: It's so bright that I can't open my eyes.

japanese: 今日は一日嫌な日だった。
english: Today was a bad day.

japanese: なんか気持ち悪い。船に酔ったかもしれない。
english: I kind of feel queasy. I might've gotten seasick on the boat.

japanese: もう遅いんだから早く寝なさい。
english: It's late, so go to bed.

japanese: サッカーが上手くなりたくて実は隠れて練習していた。
english: I wanted to get good at soccer and actually used to practice in secret.

japanese: 家の鍵が見つからないんだ。
english: I can't find my house keys.

japanese: 「カチカチのフロントガラスにこのポットのあっついお茶かけて」「気でも狂ったのか？」
english: "Pour this pot of hot tea over the icy windscreen." "Have you gone barking mad?"

japanese: 固定概念にとらわれないようにしなさい。
english: Try to think outside the box.

japanese: 前のままでも大丈夫だったよ。
english: It was fine the way it was.

japanese: そのままでもよかったのに。
english: It was fine the way it was.

japanese: 弟さんもアート系の仕事をされてたわ。
english: His younger brother also worked in the field of art.

japanese: 弟さんも芸術関係の仕事に携わっていらっしゃったのよ。
english: His younger brother also worked in the field of art.

japanese: 建物は、灰と化した。
english: The building turned to ashes.

japanese: 建物は、灰燼と化した。
english: The building turned to ashes.

japanese: 建物は灰になってしまいました。
english: The building turned to ashes.

japanese: 島から本土までは４０キロです。
english: It's forty kilometers from the island to the mainland.

japanese: 島から本州までは40Kmです。
english: It's forty kilometers from the island to the mainland.

japanese: 人は、橋の代わりに壁を作るから孤独なんだ。
english: People are lonely because they build walls instead of bridges.

japanese: 子どもが泣きながら地団太を踏んでいます。
english: The child is crying and stamping his feet.

japanese: ママとパパは今日は何したの？
english: What did Mom and Dad do today?

japanese: 「唇が割れてるけど、どうしたの？」「弟と一緒にばか騒ぎしてて、口を蹴られちゃったんだ」
english: "How did you split your lip?" "My brother and I were horseplaying, and he ended up kicking me in the mouth."

japanese: 「唇が切れてるけど、どうしたの？」「弟とふざけ合ってたらさぁ、口蹴られちゃったんだ」
english: "How did you split your lip?" "My brother and I were horseplaying, and he ended up kicking me in the mouth."

japanese: 本当に、懲りない人だね。
english: Truly, you are a person who will not learn from experience.

japanese: 彼は小さな売店で花を売っています。
english: He sells flowers in a little kiosk.

english: Will you stop dragging up conversations from 30 years ago!

japanese: トムが誰と付き合おうと、私の知ったこっちゃない。
english: It's none of my concern as to whoever Tom dates.

japanese: 「冷蔵庫の中、見た？」「見てない。何か買ってきてくれたの？」「見てのお楽しみ！」
english: "Did you look in the fridge?" "No. Did you get me something?" "See for yourself."

japanese: 地団駄を踏んでも無駄よ。駄目なものは駄目。
english: It's no use stamping your feet. No means no.

japanese: もうちょっと、頑張ってみたら？
english: Why don't you try a little harder?

japanese: 生半可な気持ちで、海女にはなれないよ。
english: You can't become an ama diver if you're not fully committed.

japanese: 自分の非を認めない人っているよね。
english: Some people can't admit they're wrong.

japanese: 昨夜、3回も戻しちゃった。
english: I threw up three times last night.

japanese: 禁煙席をお願いしたんですが。
english: I asked for a seat in the no-smoking compartment.

japanese: あの鳥はフランス語で何て言うの？
english: What do you call that bird in French?

japanese: 「また負けたよ」「マジで。8連敗かよ？」
english: "They lost again." "You don't say. What's that, the eighth time in a row?"

japanese: 「また負けだって」「本当に？8連敗ってこと？」
english: "They lost again." "You don't say. What's that, the eighth time in a row?"

japanese: サルに噛まれた。
english: I was bitten by a monkey.

japanese: ドアに「関係者以外の立ち入りを禁じる」という貼り紙がしてあるにもかかわらず、トムは勝手に中に入って行った。
english: Despite a sign on the door that said "Authorized Personnel Only," Tom just went right in.

japanese: ネギを刻むときは、手を切らないように気をつけてね。
english: When you're chopping onions, be careful not to cut your hand.

japanese: 野菜を切るときは、野菜に添える方の手は「ネコの手」にするんだよ。
english: When cutting vegetables, form a "claw" with the hand holding the vegetables in place.

japanese: くれた本、読み終わったよ。
english: I finished reading the book you gave me.

japanese: どちらの表現をよく使いますか？
english: Which do you say more often?

japanese: 普段どう言ってる？
english: How do you usually say it?

japanese: あなた自身は、どう言ってますか？
english: How do you usually say it?

japanese: 「もう先延ばしは、やめる時間ですよ」「後でね」
english: "It's time to stop procrastinating." "I'll stop later."

japanese: ほんの気持ちです。
english: It's just a little something from me.

japanese: ゲームやるの好きだったから、色々知ってるよ。
english: I liked playing games, so I know a lot about them.

japanese: 携帯電話が鳴った。
english: My cell phone rang.

japanese: 彼女の目は喜びでキラキラしてた。
english: Her eyes sparkled with joy.

japanese: 「変な日本語でごめんなさい。でも英語もできません」「ちょっと、聞いてもいい？君は日本人？」「いいえ、宇宙人です」「あ、そういうことね！僕もキツネで、まだ人間の言葉を勉強してるところだから、その気持ち分かるよ！英語、やけに難しいしね〜」
english: "I am sorry for my odd Japanese. But I cannot speak English." "Hey, can I ask you something? Are you Japanese?" "No. I am an alien." "Ah, I gotcha! I'm a fox, and I'm still trying to learn human languages, so I get what you're going through. English is so friggin' hard, isn't it?"

japanese: 「今日さぁ、転校していった友達と偶然会ったんだ」「そうなんだ」「うん。そしたら、映画の話になってさ、『今度一緒に観に行こう！』って言われたんだけど、行ってきていい？」「まぁ、いいけど、その友達って、男の子なの？女の子なの？」「......」
english: "I just ran into a friend today who had transferred schools a while back." "Cool!" "Yeah. Then, we talked about movies, and they suggested we go watch one sometime soon. Is that OK?" "Sure! But, is this friend a boy or a girl?" "....."

japanese: いい加減にしないと、本当に怒るよ。
english: If you don't cut it out, I'm going to get angry for real.

japanese: 「算数」と「数学」って何が違うの？
english: What's the difference between "maths" and "arithmetic"?

japanese: バス停は、ここから歩いて5分です。
english: The bus stop is a five-minute walk from here.

japanese: 男の子も女の子も、かわいいと思う。
english: I think both boys and girls are cute.

japanese: ケモナーだからって、自分のこと動物だと思ってるわけじゃないんだよ。
english: Just because I'm a furry doesn't mean I think I'm an animal.

japanese: そんなミスは二度としないと、トムは約束した。
english: Tom promised he wouldn't make a mistake like that again.

japanese: 僕らの家に泊まっていいよ。
english: You can stay here with us.

japanese: 僕らと一緒に、ここにいていいよ。
english: You can stay here with us.

japanese: 「月曜って、都合はどう？」「月曜は、無理だよ。火曜なら大丈夫だよ」
english: "Is Monday OK?" "I can't do Monday, but I'm free on Tuesday."

japanese: 「月曜って、都合はどう？」「月曜はちょっと。できれば火曜にしてくれる？」
english: "How about Monday?" "Monday isn't a good time. Can we do it Tuesday?"

japanese: トイレに行ってもいいですか？もう我慢できないんです。
english: Can I please go to the bathroom? It's an emergency.

japanese: 明後日、パーティーを開く予定なんです。
english: We're going to have a party the day after tomorrow.

japanese: 新しい車ね、前のより燃費がいいのよ。
english: My new car gets better gas mileage than my old one.

japanese: トムは食料を買った。
english: Tom bought some food.

japanese: トムはうんざりした。
english: Tom got fed up.

japanese: この先一生ここに住みたいな。
english: I want to live here for the rest of my life.

japanese: 午前中はずっとトムを手伝ってたよ。
english: I spent all morning helping Tom.

japanese: 世界遺産でもある宮島の「厳島神社」は、潮が満ちると神社全体がまるで海に浮かんでいるかのように見えます。その姿は神秘的で、世界中から訪れる観光客を魅了し続けています。
english: Also known for being a world heritage site, the Itsukushima Shrine in Miyajima gives the impression that it is floating in the ocean whenever the tides come in. Its mystical appearance continues to attract tourists from all over the world.

japanese: どうして、バナナって曲がってるの？
english: Why is a banana curved?

japanese: フォークの先が曲がっちゃった。
english: The tines of the fork were bent.

japanese: 山国です。
english: It's a very mountainous country.

japanese: 山の多い国です。
english: It's a very mountainous country.

japanese: エチオピアは山国です。
english: Ethiopia is a very mountainous country.

japanese: エチオピアは、山が多い国です。
english: Ethiopia is a very mountainous country.

japanese: りんごは皮を剥き半分に切ります。芯は取り除きましょう。
english: Peel the apples and cut them in half, cutting out the core.

japanese: リンゴは皮をむき半分に切り、芯は取る。
english: Peel the apples and cut them in half, cutting out the core.

japanese: 私は日本人です。日本語以外は、英語が少しできる程度ですが、仲良くしてね。
english: I'm Japanese. Other than Japanese, I only speak a little English, but I hope we can get to know each other.

japanese: 着いたらすぐ、メッセージ送ってね。
english: Send me a message as soon as you've arrived.

japanese: 図書館で本を読んでいると、トムが血相を変えてやってきた。「どうしたの？」って聞くと、自分の彼女がジョンと浮気をしたというのだ。トムはかなり怒っているようだった。
english: I was reading a book in the library when Tom came in with a wild look in his eyes. "What's wrong?" I asked him. He told me that his girlfriend had cheated on him with John. He looked pretty angry about it.

japanese: こちらをクリックしてください。
english: Please click here.

japanese: 自分の親に聞きなよ。
english: Ask your parents.

japanese: 小さい頃から、グズベリーが好きでした。
english: Ever since I was a child, I liked gooseberries.

japanese: 窓閉めるの忘れちゃった。
english: I forgot to close the windows.

japanese: 窓閉めるの忘れてた。
english: I forgot to close the windows.

japanese: 「母さん、ちょっとバスケしてくる」「はい。はい。行ってらっしゃい」「行ってきます！」「気をつけてね。夕飯までには、帰ってきなさいよ」「は〜い」
english: "Mom, I'm going out to play basketball for a bit." "OK. Bye." "See ya!" "Take care out there, and be back before dinner." "I will."

japanese: 「家ではスペイン語で、学校では英語を話すんだよね？」「そうだよ」「じゃぁ、友達とバスケする時って、英語でするの？それともスペイン語？」「英語だよ。僕の友達は、スペイン語も少しわかるんだけど、でも話せるのはＮＧワードぐらいだから」
english: "You speak Spanish at home, and English at school, right?" "Right." "What about when you play basketball with your friends? Do you speak English or Spanish?" "English. My friends understand Spanish a bit, but all they know how to say is swear words."

japanese: こんな寒いところで、待ってられないわ。
english: I can't stand and wait in a place this cold!

japanese: 「先輩、お昼ご飯、奢ってください！」「いつもいつも集るな」「いいじゃないですかぁ。先輩、昨日、バイト代が入ったんでしょ？」「仕方ないな。何食べに行く？」
english: "Senpai, please treat me to lunch!" "You should stop forever sponging off of me." "It's alright isn't it? Didn't you get payment from your part time job yesterday?" "I guess it can't be helped. What do you want to eat?"

japanese: お墓に参る時は、お線香とろうそく、それからお花を忘れずに持っててね。
english: When you go visit the grave, don't forget to bring incense and candles, oh, and flowers too.

japanese: お墓参りをする時は、掃除道具も持っていくといいね。
english: It's a good idea to bring cleaning equipment with you when you go to visit a grave.

japanese: お湯が沸くまで時間がかかるから、その間に洗い物を済ませちゃいましょう！
english: It'll take some time for the water to boil, so in the meantime, let's get these dishes over with!

japanese: 責任取るなんて面倒くせーなぁ。
english: Being responsible is annoying.

japanese: 「もしもし、営業部です」「斎藤くんいるかね？」「斎藤部長ですか？」「そうだ」「失礼ですが.......」「田中だよ。田中」「失礼しました。部長、田中常務からお電話です」
english: "Sales department, how can I help you?" "Is Saito there?" "Mr. Saito, our manager?" "Right." "May I ask who's calling?" "It's Tanaka." "Excuse me. Boss! Director Tanaka is on the phone."

japanese: 昨夜のこと覚えてる？
english: What do you remember about last night?

japanese: あの男が、私のバッグを盗んだの。
english: That man stole my bag.

japanese: 急がないと、お昼食べ損ねるよ。
english: Hurry up, or you'll miss lunch.

japanese: 私が間違ってたわ。私が話したこと、忘れて。
english: I was wrong. Forget what I told you.

japanese: 俺が悪かった。俺が言ったこと、忘れてくれ。
english: I was wrong. Forget what I said.

japanese: あいつの車、カーブでスリップしたんだよ。
english: His car skidded on the bend.

japanese: 「トム、私のヨーグルト知らない？」「ヨーグルトなら食べたよ。俺に買ってきてくれたんだと思った」
english: "Where's my yoghurt, Tom?" "I've eaten it. I thought you'd bought it for me."

japanese: 汗臭いよ。シャワー浴びてこい。
english: You smell sweaty. Go and have a shower.

japanese: 汗臭い。シャワー浴びといで。
english: You smell sweaty. Go and have a shower.

japanese: 去年、俺と結婚したんだ。
english: She married me last year.

japanese: 窓閉め忘れてた。
english: I forgot to close a window.

japanese: 「お好み焼き」って美味しいけど、お店によって「当たり外れ」があるよね？
english: Okonomiyaki itself is delicious, but it's a hit-or-miss depending on the restaurant that makes it.

japanese: トム、ここ書き間違えてるよ。
english: Tom, you've written it incorrectly here.

japanese: トム、ここ読み間違えたんじゃない？質問と答えが合ってないよ。
english: Tom, did you misread something here? Your answer doesn't match the question.

japanese: トム、ここ訳し間違えてるよ。
english: Tom, you've mistranslated it here.

japanese: お褒めの言葉をありがとうございます。嬉しかったです。
english: Thank you for your words of praise. I was very happy.

japanese: 惜しい！あともうちょっとだったのに！
english: Too bad! You were almost there!

japanese: 英語の上手さって、人としての価値とは関係ない。
english: How good you are at English has nothing to do with your value as a person.

japanese: 「トムって、お風呂から出てきた？」「さぁ？」「えっ、もしかして、またお風呂で寝てる？」
english: "Did Tom get out of the bath?" "Well..." "Don't tell me he's sleeping in the bath again!"

japanese: 小さな子どもは、たった５ｃｍの深さの水で溺れ窒息してしまう可能性があります。
english: With small children, there's a risk of drowning even with water as low as 5 centimeters deep.

japanese: 日本語の「いい人」は、必ずしも褒め言葉ではない。
english: In Japanese, "ii-hito" isn't necessarily a compliment.

japanese: その表現、いい線いってる！
english: The expression is right on track.

japanese: その表現、捨てたもんじゃない！
english: That expression is far from meaningless!

japanese: 警察はすぐに来ました。
english: The police came quickly.

japanese: 救急車はすぐに来ました。
english: The ambulance came quickly.

japanese: 消防車がすぐに来ました。
english: The fire truck came quickly.

japanese: 消防車はすぐにやって来た。
english: The fire truck came quickly.

japanese: トムは人に流されやすい人です。
english: Tom is a very impressionable person.

japanese: トム、コロナになったのよ。
english: Tom got covid.

japanese: 雪で車が立ち往生しています。
english: The car is stuck in the snow.

japanese: トムは牛乳を買いに、そこの角のお店に行ったよ。
english: Tom went to the corner store to buy milk.

japanese: 真冬にお風呂なんかで寝てたら、凍え死ぬよ。
english: If you sleep in the bath smack-dab in the middle of winter, you could freeze to death.

japanese: ここの体育館、底冷えするね。寒くて凍え死にそう。
english: This gym is like an ice box, right? It's so cold I feel as if I'm going to freeze to death.

japanese: トムは本当に結婚したのかしら。
english: I wonder if Tom got married.

japanese: あなたさえ私のことをおぼえていてくれれば、ほかのすべての人に忘れられたってかまわない。
english: It doesn't matter if everyone else forgets about me, as long as you still remember.

japanese: 家の言葉が友達の言葉と違う場合、大抵子供は友達の言葉を上手に話せるようになるんです。
english: When children speak a different language at home than with their friends, they usually become more proficient at the language they speak with friends.

japanese: 夜、君の声が聞こえてるよ。
english: I still hear you at night.

japanese: 日本で君に会えることに、ワクワクしてるよ！
english: I'm excited to be able to meet you in Japan.

japanese: 大丈夫？泣きそうに見えるんだけど。
english: Are you OK? You look like you're about to cry.

japanese: 大丈夫？泣きそうな顔して。
english: Are you OK? You look like you're about to cry.

japanese: 問題があったら、僕に言っていいって知ってるよね？
english: You know that you can tell me if something's going on, right?

japanese: 何かあったら、僕に言えばいいって分かってるよね？
english: You know that you can tell me if something's going on, right?

japanese: 食べたかったら、残ってるケーキも食べていいよ。
english: You can eat the rest of the cake if you want.

japanese: トムがいないんだよ。どこにいるか知らない？
english: Tom isn't here. Do you know where he is?

japanese: それは、後でお答えします。
english: I'll answer that later.

japanese: 日本語を喋れるようになりたいから、暇があったら、シャドーイングしよっと。
english: I want to be able to speak Japanese, so when I have the spare time, I'll do some shadowing.

japanese: 本当にやらないといけないと思った時には、ちゃんとやってるよ。
english: If I think it's truly something I need to do, I'll do it properly.

japanese: 「昨夜、遅くまでごそごそしてたわね。何時に寝たの？」「五時。だって、前の日に麻雀しててさぁ、寝たのが明け方で起きたの夕方の５時過ぎだったんだよ。寝れなくて」「なるほどね、朝日と共に寝て、夕日と共に起きるってことね。大学生ならではだよね」
english: "You were fumbling about until late last night, weren't you? What time did you go to bed?" "Five o'clock. It's because I was playing mahjong the day before. I went to sleep at dawn and got up at 5 in the evening. I couldn't sleep during the night." "I see. So going to sleep with the rising sun and waking with the setting sun. Something you'd only find a university student doing."

japanese: どっか、見たいところがある？あったら言ってね。
english: Is there any place you'd like to see? If there is, let me know.

japanese: スカンク見たよ。
english: I saw a skunk.

japanese: 「大きくなったら、何になりたい？」「億万長者」
english: "What do you want to be when you grow up?" "A millionaire."

japanese: 「さっき、外にスカンクがいたよ」「スカンク？」「うん。どっかから逃げ出してきたのかな？」
english: "I just saw a skunk outside." "A skunk?" "Yeah. Maybe it was running away from somewhere?"

japanese: 見て、１０００文になるよ。
english: Guys, I'm getting to my 1,000th sentence.

japanese: 俺、いつか雑誌の表紙を飾るような有名人になってみせるよ。
english: Someday, I'm going to be famous enough to be on the cover of magazines. You'll see.

japanese: 彼の名前は、Ｔで始まってＭで終わります。
english: His name begins with a T and ends with an M.

japanese: この前、その女の子見かけたよ。
english: I saw that girl the other day.

japanese: 詳しく丁寧な説明をありがとうございます。では、残念ですがアドプトは、見送ることにします。
english: Thank you very much for kindly explaining it so well. But, sadly, I think I'll pass on adopting it.

japanese: 話ごまかすなよ。
english: Don't twist your words with me.

japanese: 最近、欲しいものはある？
english: Is there something you want lately?

japanese: 絶対分からない。
english: We can never tell.

japanese: これは、干し草？それとも藁？
english: Is this hay or straw?

japanese: この作品は、パブリックドメインになりました。
english: This work has entered the public domain.
